list_definition.definition: one of the parts of something that is divided among several people etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We all had a share of the cake
We each paid our share of the bill.

list_definition.definition: the part played by a person in something done etc by several people etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I had no share in the decision.

list_definition.definition: a fixed sum of money invested in a business company by a shareholder
(usually with among, between, with) to divide among a number of people

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We shared the money between us.

list_definition.mean_english: có chung cái gì với ai
list_definition.definition: to have, use etc (something that another person has or uses); to allow someone to use (something one has or owns)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The little boy hated sharing his toys.

list_definition.definition: (sometimes with in) to have a share of with someone else

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He wouldn’t let her share the cost of the taxi.
